title: First Transistor Invented
description: Bell Labs scientists John Bardeen, Walter Brattain, and William Shockley invented the first working transistor, revolutionizing electronics.

title: Intel 4004 Microprocessor Released
description: Intel released the 4004, the first commercially available microprocessor, marking the beginning of the microcomputer revolution.

title: Apple II Computer Launch
description: Apple Computer Company launched the Apple II, one of the first successful mass-produced personal computers.

title: SMIC Founded in Shanghai
description: Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corporation (SMIC) is established, laying the foundation for mainland China's foundry sector.

title: First 300 mm Wafer Fab Begins Production
description: Infineon and Philips open Fab 300 in Dresden, ushering in the 300 mm wafer era that slashes cost-per-chip.

title: China Joins World Trade Organization
description: China's WTO accession accelerates global electronics off-shoring and positions the country as the world's factory for PCs and smartphones.

title: AMD Launches Opteron – 64-bit x86 Debut
description: AMD releases the Opteron server CPU, bringing 64-bit computing to the x86 ecosystem and challenging Intel's dominance.

title: ASML Introduces First Immersion Lithography Tool
description: ASML debuts the TWINSCAN XT:1250i 193 nm immersion scanner, unlocking 45 nm-class optical scaling.

title: SMIC Raises $1.8 Bn in Dual-Listing IPO
description: SMIC's Hong Kong and NYSE debut provides crucial capital for China's catch-up drive.

title: AMD Opens Fab 36 – 300 mm Dresden Plant
description: Fab 36 becomes AMD's first 300 mm fab, boosting capacity for Athlon and Opteron processors.

title: Apple Announces Switch to Intel Processors
description: Steve Jobs reveals that future Macs will migrate from PowerPC to Intel CPUs, reshaping the PC processor landscape.

title: TSMC Begins 65 nm Volume Production
description: TSMC's 65 nm node enters mass production, extending the foundry's process-leadership streak.

title: iPhone Launch – Mobile-SoC Era Begins
description: Apple releases the first-generation iPhone, turbo-charging demand for advanced mobile processors and basebands.

title: Intel Ships 45 nm Penryn with High-k Metal Gate
description: Penryn introduces high-k / metal-gate technology, mitigating leakage and extending Moore's Law.

title: AMD Spins Off GlobalFoundries
description: AMD and Abu Dhabi's ATIC create GlobalFoundries, birthing a new pure-play foundry competitor.

title: TSMC Starts 40 nm Volume Production
description: Launch of 40 nm node enables power-efficient GPUs and mobile chips, but also exposes yield challenges.

title: GlobalFoundries Acquires Chartered Semiconductor
description: Deal transforms GlobalFoundries into the world's No. 2 foundry with a strong Singapore footprint.

title: Tōhoku Earthquake Disrupts Auto-Chip Supply
description: Japan's magnitude-9.0 quake and tsunami knock out Renesas's Naka MCU fab, spotlighting supply-chain fragility.

title: Intel Announces 22 nm 3-D Tri-Gate Transistors
description: Intel unveils the world's first mass-production FinFETs, cutting power by up to 50 % and boosting speed.

title: Thailand Floods Disrupt Semiconductor & HDD Supply
description: Historic floods wipe out key packaging and hard-disk plants, driving up component prices worldwide.

title: Intel, Samsung & TSMC Invest $6.3 Bn in ASML for EUV
description: Chip giants buy minority stakes in ASML to accelerate EUV and 450 mm wafer R&D.

title: SK Hynix Wuxi DRAM Fab Fire
description: Explosion and fire at Hynix's Wuxi plant removes ~15 % of global DRAM output, spiking prices.

title: China Launches National IC Industry Investment Fund ('Big Fund')
description: Beijing sets up a $21 bn state fund to turbo-charge domestic semiconductor manufacturing.

title: China Launches 'Made in China 2025'
description: Beijing unveils a 10-year plan to achieve chip self-sufficiency and climb the manufacturing value chain.
source: State Council of the People's Republic of China

title: U.S. Blocks Broadcom–Qualcomm Deal
description: President Trump blocks Broadcom's $117 bn hostile takeover of Qualcomm on national-security grounds, marking a new era of CFIUS activism.

title: Huawei Added to U.S. Entity List
description: Commerce Department blacklists Huawei and 68 affiliates, cutting off access to U.S. chips and software.

title: ASML EUV Export License to China Frozen
description: Dutch government, under U.S. pressure, halts ASML's first EUV lithography shipment to China, denying access to leading-edge tooling.

title: COVID-19 Triggers Global Chip Shortage
description: Pandemic demand spikes and supply disruptions create the worst semiconductor shortage in decades, affecting 169 industries worldwide.

title: TSMC Announces $12 Bn Arizona Fab
description: World's top foundry commits to its first advanced-node fab in the U.S., kick-starting American on-shoring efforts.

title: SMIC Added to U.S. Entity List
description: Washington blacklists China's leading foundry, cutting it off from advanced U.S. equipment and technology.

title: TSMC–Sony Announce Kumamoto Fab (JASM)
description: Japan offers subsidies for a joint specialty-process fab, marking its return to front-end manufacturing.

title: Intel Unveils $20 Bn Ohio Mega-Fab
description: Intel announces two new fabs in Ohio as the centerpiece of its IDM 2.0 foundry strategy.

title: Nvidia–Arm $40 Bn Deal Collapses
description: Regulatory pushback forces Nvidia to abandon its takeover of Arm, averting major consolidation in chip IP.

title: Ukraine War Halts Half of World Neon Supply
description: Invasion disrupts neon gas output vital for lithography lasers, highlighting raw-material vulnerabilities.

title: U.S. CHIPS and Science Act Signed
description: Creates $52.7 bn in incentives for domestic semiconductor R&D and manufacturing.

title: U.S. Issues Sweeping China Chip Export Controls
description: Commerce Department bars advanced AI chips and 14 nm-and-below fab tools from reaching China.

title: UK Orders Nexperia to Sell Newport Wafer Fab
description: Using its new National Security & Investment Act, Britain forces Chinese-owned Nexperia to divest the country's largest chip plant.

title: Netherlands Joins U.S.–Japan Export-Control Pact
description: Dutch government aligns with allies to curb advanced DUV/EUV lithography exports to China.

title: TSMC Breaks Ground on 3rd Arizona Fab (2 nm Class)
description: TSMC expands its Phoenix campus to six fabs and over $165 bn in investment, anchoring U.S.–Taiwan foundry ties.
